author: djtitoflows Nerdy Dimensions

text: Your first mistake: buying a 3DS on launch day. Your second: giving it up; because it has turned out to be one of the best handheld gaming devices ever.
author: BoomstickAsh

text: I bought a 3DS on launch day, hoping it would bring a different perspective to my mobile gaming.  Unfortunately, in my eyes, it never really did, and I ended up giving it to my nephew for his birthday.  The only game I miss from this system was Pilotwings Resort, and the relaxing feeling it gave me.

text:

author: Pander8874

text: @Masz52 To me real vgm truly sets the mood and atmosphere of a particular environment and whenever you think of or see that environment or hear the music you immediately think of the other. In other words, the music and the environment it was put to are inseparably linked in your memory because the music brought its environment to life.

author: David Fisher

text: @Masz52 I think he's referring to the kind of music people were spoiled by in the late 80s/early-mid 90s where music was more memorable than a lot of music people tend to compare to today. I would tend to disagree; I feel that video game music has only evolved further from a limited palette of 3 tones at a time to sweeping orchestral pieces like in Beyond Good & Evil.
